greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of times n occurs in A095972.
comment: Alternative definition: a(n) = number of k such that A000224(k) = k - n.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: a(0) is 2, because 0 occurs only twice in A095972. a(1) is 1, because 1 occurs only once in A095972.
mathematica: nn = 100; t = Table[Length[Complement[Range[n-1], Union[Mod[Range[n]^2, n]]]], {n, 2*nn + 2}]; Table[Count[t, n], {n, 0, nn}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Nov 06 2012 *)
results.author: _Dmitri Kamenetsky_, Nov 03 2012
